item.title: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description:
• Working on multi-agent self-play in atari games in collaborative and competetive settings.
  • Currently working on using variational autoencoders to disentangle multiple near optimal policies extracted using latent code.
  • Initial results on the model gave win probability of 72%, which is close to 80% SOTA values, and much better than human score of 40% in multi-agent CTF.
  • Developing a generative model for InfoRL to maintain unsupervised setting for latent code generation to allow all standard MARL algorithms to be used with InfoRL.
